name: Red Lion Hotel Pasco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facility in itself was fine. The room was clean and the king-sized bed was very comfortable. However, we stayed at this hotel because we were celebrating a friend's birthday in the Grizzly Bar below. It was a Friday night, and there was salsa dancing in the bar. The crowd was probably 99% Latin Americans/Latin American descendants. My husband and I each had a drink and then I went to ask for a glass of water at the bar, and the bartender told me that they only had $2 bottled water available on that particular night. (I understood this to mean that when the Latin Americans were there they only had $2 bottled water and no tap water.) When the bar closed, the bouncers - like 5 of them - corralled us to the door. It was really weird and pushy. We barely got to say goodbye to our friends before they were pushed out the door. They tried to be nicer to us once they saw us turn around to go back to our room, realizing we were hotel guests. Strange. Honestly, if you are going to cater to the Latin American crowd, you need to be more culturally sensitive and let them say goodbye to their friends before pushing them out the door. You can expect it will take them a little while to do that. What's more, I don't think even Anglo-Americans are that quick at getting out the door when the bar closes.
reviews.title: Poor Service on Latin Dancing Night

reviews.text: I was very dissapointed by my experience at this facility. I had reservations for a double King room that was to adjoining to a room my parents were staying. We were in Pasco visiting my nephew and his wife and doing some steelhead fishing. When we arrived to check in, just before 3 pm, my parents were able to check in while I was told my room was not clean. I left my cell phone number and went to visit family expecting a call to let me know when my room was ready. I returned at 9:30 pm to find that the room had not been cleaned and they had not figured out what room I was being moved to. I waited for approx. 30 minutes for them to finally decide that they could not replace my double king and I was put in a single queen. I asked if they would clean it for me to move into the next day and was told no, they were too full. This reasoning made no sense to me as I was willing to vacate the single by putting my luggage in my parents room, but was again told no. The desk clerks idea of compensation was to give me 2 vouchers for a drink at the bar, 10% off at the resraunt or a free breakfast buffet. I used them for breakfast but felt this was a very small gesture for the difference in the rooms. I was awakened every morning by doors slamming on the airport shuttle at 3 am.
reviews.title: Have Had Better Experiences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can get this for a good price online, and it's a pretty good property. I've stayed there several times in the last year or 2, and the beds are good, cleanliness good, nice outdoor pool, very good accessibility, service good, 3 restaurants (1s fairly priced). Nicer property than the Kennewick Red Lion, much better prices available than the Richland Red Lion. Unfortunately to get decent prices (under $100/night) you have to use one of the online bargain websites and play that game.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: The service was exceptional, and the rooms a bit cleaner than expected, considering the location and age of the building. It wasn't perfect, but overall a decent experience.
reviews.title: Service was consistently fantastic. Fairly clean, but older building.

reviews.text: Spent a week in this hotel and so had ample time to find things wrong! However, there really wasn't anything wrong! Staff are very courteous and helpful, rooms are clean and quite large for the price. I also noticed lots of families at the pool, playing in the grass, etc and so it's easy to see that this facility is very family friendly. Grounds are well kept and pool well maintained. Simply a great place!
reviews.title: Great property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will never go back to this hotel again. Last nite, 2 bugs flew out of the bed. They gave us a better room but when we went to take showers this morning, we had no hot water. What's the point of having a shower, if the water is cold?!? We called the front desk and they said they were working on it and they'd give us a room discount. At check out, they refused to give us the discount because the person who does that was gone. I will never go back to this hotel again.
reviews.title: Bugs in the Bed!!!!! No hot water for showers!!! Awful experience.

reviews.text: Having spent one night at the Pasco Red Lion, we have agreed that we would stay there again if we make a return trip to Pasco. The room and the beds were very comfortable and it was very close to the community college, which was the reason for our visit to Pasco. The one downside was that the restaurant didn't serve dinner the night we arrived, much to our surprise, so we needed to go off-premise that evening. The person who checked us in was not helpful - suggested the bar while our teenager stood right there with us! We used the phone book in the room to find a restaurant.
reviews.title: We'd Stay Here Again

reviews.text: Okay: Friendly staff. Food good most of the time.
reviews.title: Okay and not okay

reviews.text: Not okay: One wing had no elevator to the second floor. Beds were not super comfortable. Magnetic room keys demagnatized several times a day. Service at restaurants was extremely slow.
reviews.title: DIS SATISFIED

reviews.text: We requested 2 beds for 3 adults. We recieved 1 king bed. Lucky for them because there were 2 adults and 1 small child instead. We were told this was the managers doing. We called 800-733-5466 and talked to a young woman @ 5pm pacific standard time due to the fact we were running late. She said there was no problem because we had our reservation held with a credit card. This should have never happened and should never happen again!
reviews.title: Awesome staff and room

reviews.text: Pasco has limited hotel choices, although the Tri-Cites (add Kennewick and Richland) have more choices if you are willing to drive quite a ways. The Red Lion is an older but generally well-maintained convention style hotel. Staff were courteous and efficient. Room was fine - nothing exceptional, but nothing bad except for generally showing its age. Except the tub/shower: caulk and grout are badly in need of cleaning and replacement. Anything that looks like mold in a shower is a bad thing even if it isn't mold. Beds and bedding were of a good standard and comfortable. I would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Solid choice, all things considered.

reviews.text: We attend a convention here every year, and the staff is great at putting up with all of us! However, they never seem to staff the resteraunt very well, and you would think after 9 years of this, they would get the hint. Besides, the food isn;t great in the little one. They used to have a coffee bar in the lobby, but now it is in the resteraunt and those people don't know how to make an espresso to save their lives. There is a great coffee stand in the parking lot, so that has been my saving grace!! Overall, worth the money to stay
reviews.title: We stay every summer

reviews.text: Great experience. The front desk staff was awesome. Nic checked us in and gave us an upgrade. Our room was a Parlor Suite with a jetted tub. Andrea was the agent in the morning when we left. She was very helpful with all my questions regarding the area. My only complaint would be, is that when we asked for a roll away bed, we were charged $10.00 for it. No one told us there would be a charge. But with that being the only very minor downfall, we will definately be visiting again in March!!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: Worked for BNSF and was issued a room that was bug infested as well as pubic and other body hair. Management took their sweet time to avoid me and to issue me a new room. Management's solution was to move me but not offer any services to wash my clothes and belongings that were also infested. To add insult to injury, this same manger defamed me to protect the Red Lion contract with BNSF. This cost me my job as well as contaminating my home when I arrived there. Try explaining that to your wife and kids. This hotel is filthy and so is their Grizzly Bar ( I don't think they have ever cleaned the counter under the blender and registers). Male bartenders spend more time socializing with the waitresses than taking care of their restaurant customers. Do yourself a favor and steer clear of this roach motel. It could and probably will cost you your home life and your job like it did me.
reviews.title: Bugs cost me my job and homelife

reviews.text: Disliked: Rooms, Service, Location, Food, Value,and most of all MANAGEMENT'S VINDICTIVE BEHAVIOR
reviews.title: A very sincere THANK YOU

reviews.text: The property was much nicer than I expected. It was clean and well-maintained, and the staff was excellent. The many amenities made for a very comfortable stay. I will not hesitate to stay at this facility again should I have the occasion to do so. For the price, it was certainly a great value.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: I stay at this Red Lion Pasco property between 15 and 20 nights per year since 2007 and have been time and time again impressed with the staff there. The ladies at the Seasons Restaurant know me by name and greet me with my coffee when I arrive for breakfast. Overall, I am made to feel like as much like I am at home as any hotel could offer.
reviews.title: They consistently treat me very well.

reviews.text: We stayed in this Hotel 4 years ago and it was great and I did not mind paying the price, but the 2nd visit was not as pleasant. The carpets were dirty, bathtub had mold in 3 places between tub and tile (not little spots pretty large) Vending machices for water and soda was $2.00 for anything, therefore a fairly good profit there also. Breakfast buffet was average (sausage great, bacon barely hit the skillet (very raw), eggs good, potatoes not done (needed to be cooked a little longer). Pool was great, grounds were great but inside left a little to be desire, I expected a cleaner hotel in hallways and rooms for the price. Complimentary shampoo was one extra small bottle that could be used up by 2 females, this was a reservation for 3 adults/1 child for 2 nights, had to request more and received one more bottle. That is what I call rationing. I have traveled cross country several times and the future will be Holiday Inn or Holiday Inn Express and some Best Western Hotels
reviews.title: 2nd time from great to poor rating

reviews.text: Stayed here for business a couple of nights. The hotel is starting to show it's age, but was clean and the rooms are a good size. The pool area is very nice and the location is right off the interstate. The onsite restaurant is quite good, and the breakfast buffet is pretty good value, although it would be nice if they changed the menu a bit.
reviews.title: Showing it's age, but still OK

reviews.text: I spent approximately five weeks at this hotel. Company booked me here. Every week was an adventure. My complaints to the company were placated with a $50 gift certificate to spend at any Red Lion hotel.
reviews.title: Not Sure Why I'd Want To Stay Here Again

description: Red Lion Hotel Pasco is located in the heart of Washington Wine Country, five minutes from Kennewick, ten minutes from Richland, directly across the street from Columbia Basin College and just four blocks from the Tri-Cities Airport via our complimentary airport transportation. Upon arrival, guests will be immediately impressed with the spacious, open foyer, decorated in a traditional northwestern motif. Our 279 spacious guest rooms and 10 suites feature all the amenities that business and leisure travelers look for including free wi-fi, telephone data ports, voice mail and in-room coffee. On-site, you’ll also find a complete 24-hour fitness center, seasonal outdoor swimming pool, whirlpool and courtyard as well as a 24-hour business center. Seasons Restaurant offers full-service dining for breakfast, lunch and dinner while the highly acclaimed Bin 20 Steak & Seafood Restaurant offers fine wines with a tapas menu. On the wilder side, join guests and locals at the Grizzly Bar for drink specials and DJ dancing. We offer Red Lion's signature Roaring Start Breakfast Buffet... and don't forget, kids 10 and younger eat free with each adult. There are over 35 local wineries within a 40-minute drive of the hotel and an abundance of great shopping nearby. We are close to the Columbia River which offers fishing, boating and other water recreation, and next to Sun Willows golf course. Business professionals appreciate having Boise Cascade, Lamb Weston, the US Department of Energy and Hanford nearby. We are located directly across the street from Columbia Basin College and only 10 minutes from the local campus of Washington State University. The Red Lion Hotel Pasco is also a full service convention hotel and the perfect choice for those who appreciate service. With over 17,000 square feet of meeting and banquet space, we can accommodate groups of up to 2,100.
